20101224030107.000|20101224030110.000|CC1|>> A 11th HOUR BILL REVIVED THE 
20101224030110.000|20101224030111.000|CC1|9/11 HEALTH CARE BILL FOR       
20101224030111.000|20101224030112.000|CC1|WORKERS AT GROUND ZERO.

20101224030113.000|20101224030114.000|CC1|HARD WORK THAT THIS CHRISTMAS   
20101224030114.000|20101224030115.000|CC1|WILL BE THE BEST CHRISTMAS THAT 
20101224030115.000|20101224030116.000|CC1|I'VE EVER KNOWN.

20101224030127.000|20101224030134.000|CC1|WE COULD FULFILL OUR UNDNIABLE

20101224030223.000|20101224030224.000|CC1|THAT OLD COLLEGE TRY.           
20101224030224.000|20101224030226.000|CC1|MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND COLLEGE 
20101224030226.000|20101224030228.000|CC1|STUDENTS USUALLY END THEIR TERMS
20101224030228.000|20101224030230.000|CC1|BY CRAMMING ALL THEIR WORK INTO 
20101224030230.000|20101224030233.000|CC1|THE LAST COUPLE OF WEEKS.       
20101224030233.000|20101224030235.000|CC1|RATIFYING THE S.T.A.R.T. TREATY,
20101224030235.000|20101224030237.000|CC1|CONFIRMING JUDGES, PASSING THE  
20101224030237.000|20101224030239.000|CC1|FOOD SAFETY AND 9/11 FIRST      
20101224030239.000|20101224030240.000|CC1|RESPONDERS BILLS, REPEALING     
20101224030240.000|20101224030244.000|CC1|DON'T ASK, DON'T TELL, ALL AFTER
20101224030244.000|20101224030245.000|CC1|REACHING A HUGE TAX CUT         
20101224030245.000|20101224030247.000|CC1|COMPROMISE DEAL THAT ALSO       
20101224030247.000|20101224030250.000|CC1|EXTENDED UNEMPLOYMENT BENEFITS. 
20101224030250.000|20101224030251.000|CC1|SOME ARE CALLING IT THE MOST    
20101224030251.000|20101224030256.000|CC1|PRODUCTIVE CONGRESS SINCE THE   
20101224030256.000|20101224030256.000|CC1|1960s GREAT SOCIETY, COMPARABLE 
20101224030256.000|20101224030259.000|CC1|EVEN TO THE 1930s NEW DEAL      
20101224030259.000|20101224030300.000|CC1|CONGRESS.                       
20101224030300.000|20101224030301.000|CC1|SO WHY ARE OTHERS CALLING IT ONE
20101224030301.000|20101224030304.000|CC1|OF THE MOST POLITICALLY         
20101224030304.000|20101224030306.000|CC1|DYSFUNCTIONAL CONGRESSES EVER IN
20101224030306.000|20101224030309.000|CC1|NEED OF RULES CHANGES TO REDUCE 
20101224030309.000|20101224030309.000|CC1|OBSTRUCTION?                    
20101224030309.000|20101224030311.000|CC1|PERHAPS IT HAS SOMETHING TO DO  
20101224030311.000|20101224030313.000|CC1|WITH THIS GRAPH.                
20101224030313.000|20101224030316.000|CC1|IT SHOWS THE DRAMATIC RISE IN   
20101224030316.000|20101224030318.000|CC1|PROCEDURAL BLOCKS IN THE SENATE 
20101224030318.000|20101224030319.000|CC1|IN RECENT YEARS.                
20101224030319.000|20101224030321.000|CC1|HOW A PROCEDURE THAT WAS ONCE   
20101224030321.000|20101224030323.000|CC1|MEANT FOR EXTREME CIRCUMSTANCES 
20101224030323.000|20101224030326.000|CC1|IS NOW USED CASUALLY TO CLOG THE
20101224030326.000|20101224030327.000|CC1|ENTIRE SYSTEM.                  
20101224030327.000|20101224030329.000|CC1|WHEN THE 112th CONGRESS TAKES   
20101224030329.000|20101224030333.000|CC1|OVER ON JANUARY 5th, WILL       
20101224030333.000|20101224030335.000|CC1|FILIBUSTER REFORM BE THE NEXT   
20101224030335.000|20101224030337.000|CC1|BIG FIGHT ON THE HILL?          
20101224030337.000|20101224030340.000|CC1|JOINING ME NOW ARE NORM         
20101224030340.000|20101224030341.000|CC1|ORENSTEIN CONGRESSIONAL SCHOLAR 
20101224030341.000|20101224030344.000|CC1|AT THE AMERICAN ENTERPRISE      
20101224030344.000|20101224030348.000|CC1|SUBSTITUTE AND EZRA KLINE,      
20101224030348.000|20101224030349.000|CC1|COLUMNIST FOR THE "WASHINGTON   
20101224030349.000|20101224030349.000|CC1|POST."                          
20101224030349.000|20101224030352.000|CC1|>> EZRA, THAT GRAPH IS YOURS IN 
20101224030352.000|20101224030354.000|CC1|TERMS OF CLOCKING UP THE SYSTEM 
20101224030354.000|20101224030355.000|CC1|WITH CLOTURE MOTIONS.           
20101224030355.000|20101224030357.000|CC1|I DON'T LIKE TO CALL THEM FILL  
20101224030357.000|20101224030359.000|CC1|BUSTERS BECAUSE TECHNICALLY THEY
20101224030359.000|20101224030401.000|CC1|AREN'T FILIBUSTERS BUT I MIGHT  
20101224030401.000|20101224030403.000|CC1|SLIP INTO THE CASUAL USAGE OF IT
20101224030403.000|20101224030404.000|CC1|HERE.                           
20101224030404.000|20101224030405.000|CC1|AND THAT DOES BRING UP THE

20101224030407.000|20101224030409.000|CC1|A FIRST DAY ORDER OF BUSINESS   
20101224030409.000|20101224030409.000|CC1|COMING UP.                      
20101224030409.000|20101224030412.000|CC1|BUT HELP ME HERE.               
20101224030412.000|20101224030413.000|CC1|I AM HAVING TROUBLE THINKING    
20101224030413.000|20101224030416.000|CC1|THAT WE'VE JUST SEEN A HUGELY   
20101224030416.000|20101224030419.000|CC1|PRODUCTIVE CONGRESS AND A HUGELY

20101224030430.000|20101224030432.000|CC1|>> I THINK YOU CAN, ALTHOUGH I'D
20101224030432.000|20101224030433.000|CC1|REPHRASE THE LATTER.            
20101224030433.000|20101224030434.000|CC1|>> OKAY, GO AHEAD.              
20101224030434.000|20101224030435.000|CC1|>> IT'S NOT THAT THEY'RE GETTING

20101224030503.000|20101224030504.000|CC1|ABOUT ARE ON AUTO PILOT.

20101224030538.000|20101224030539.000|CC1|WHERE THEY HAD AN ENORMOUS

20101224030547.000|20101224030549.000|CC1|THINGS THAN YOU DO.

20101224030554.000|20101224030557.000|CC1|AND THEN DO WE NEED A RULE

20101224030602.000|20101224030604.000|CC1|THAT THEY WERE OPERATING UNDER

20101224030610.000|20101224030612.000|CC1|>> YEAH, AND OF COURSE IN SOME  
20101224030612.000|20101224030613.000|CC1|WAYS, LAWRENCE, LET ME SAY THE

20101224030623.000|20101224030625.000|CC1|WAY THE MINORITY EXPLOITED THE

20101224030627.000|20101224030628.000|CC1|WAS NEVER INTENDED.

20101224030629.000|20101224030630.000|CC1|CULTURE.

20101224030631.000|20101224030632.000|CC1|YOU'VE GOT TO CHANGE THE RULES  
20101224030632.000|20101224030633.000|CC1|FIRST AND HOPE THAT THE CULTURE 
20101224030633.000|20101224030635.000|CC1|WILL FOLLOW OR AT LEAST BREAK   
20101224030635.000|20101224030637.000|CC1|THE BACK OF SOME OF THE WORST   
20101224030637.000|20101224030638.000|CC1|DYSFUNCTIONAL ELEMENTS OF IT.   
20101224030638.000|20101224030640.000|CC1|BUT WITH ALL OF THAT, I ACTUALLY
20101224030640.000|20101224030642.000|CC1|WROTE A PIECE A YEAR AGO SAYING 
20101224030642.000|20101224030643.000|CC1|THAT WE WERE ON TRACK TO HAVING

20101224030647.000|20101224030648.000|CC1|THIS WAS BEFORE HEALTH CARE     
20101224030648.000|20101224030650.000|CC1|PASSED, BUT EXPECTING THAT IT   
20101224030650.000|20101224030651.000|CC1|WOULD AND THAT THERE WOULD BE   
20101224030651.000|20101224030652.000|CC1|WALL STREET REFORM.             
20101224030652.000|20101224030654.000|CC1|AND A PART OF IT WAS THAT EVEN  
20101224030654.000|20101224030656.000|CC1|IN THE STIMULUS PACKAGE THAT    
20101224030656.000|20101224030657.000|CC1|PASSED, WHEN YOU BEGAN TO PARSE 
20101224030657.000|20101224030700.000|CC1|IT OUT INTO THE INDIVIDUAL      
20101224030700.000|20101224030701.000|CC1|PIECES, IT WAS EXTRAORDINARY    
20101224030701.000|20101224030702.000|CC1|LEGISLATIVE ACCOMPLISHMENT.     
20101224030702.000|20101224030704.000|CC1|IF YOU MOVE BEYOND EVEN THE BIG 
20101224030704.000|20101224030706.000|CC1|THREE, THE STIMULUS, THE HEALTH

20101224031613.000|20101224031614.000|CC1|>>> YESTERDAY THE 9/11 HEALTH   
20101224031614.000|20101224031615.000|CC1|AND COMPENSATION ACT PASSED BOTH
20101224031615.000|20101224031616.000|CC1|THE HOUSE AND SENATE.           
20101224031616.000|20101224031618.000|CC1|THE BILL PROVIDES $4.2 BILLION  
20101224031618.000|20101224031620.000|CC1|IN HEALTH CARE TO THOSE WHO FELL
20101224031620.000|20101224031622.000|CC1|ILL FROM BREATHING TOXINS AT    
20101224031622.000|20101224031623.000|CC1|GROUND ZERO.                    
20101224031623.000|20101224031625.000|CC1|GETTING THE BILL PASSED WAS NOT 
20101224031625.000|20101224031625.000|CC1|EASY.                           
20101224031625.000|20101224031627.000|CC1|AS OF LAST WEEK, TWO SENATE     
20101224031627.000|20101224031629.000|CC1|REPUBLICANS REFUSED TO LET THE  
20101224031629.000|20101224031630.000|CC1|BILL COME TO A VOTE.            
20101224031630.000|20101224031632.000|CC1|REPUBLICAN SENATOR TOM COBURN   
20101224031632.000|20101224031633.000|CC1|WAS THREATENING TO BLOCK IT.    
20101224031633.000|20101224031635.000|CC1|TO GET THE BILL PASSED, IT TOOK 
20101224031635.000|20101224031637.000|CC1|THE WORK OF BOTH NEW YORK       
20101224031637.000|20101224031639.000|CC1|SENATORS PLUS ALL OF THOSE WHO  
20101224031639.000|20101224031641.000|CC1|LOBBIED WASHINGTON, JOHN FEEL
